title: ICE when simplest rust-call method is called

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
Derivation of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/16039, which was closed because it failed to compile for other reasons:

``` rust
struct A;
impl A {
    extern "rust-call" fn b(i: i32) {}
}

fn main () {
    A::b(10);
}
```

```
error: internal compiler error: argument to function with "rust-call" ABI is neither a tuple nor unit
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', /home/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/nightly-dist-rustc-linux/build/src/libsyntax/diagnostic.rs:189

stack backtrace:
```
